Although a picturesque little town surrounded by tea plantations, Hasimara's main interest to travellers is the town's railway station. It is nearest rail head to the Bhutanese border town of
, a thirty minute journey by road.
Hasimara is located on the main

line.Trains having stoppages at Hasimara includes-Kanchankanya express(13149) from Sealdah, Capital Express(13248) from Danapur,Patna, Mahananda Express(14084) from Delhi via Patna, Ranchi(15661) via Malda.
There are frequent buses from Silguri (a three to four hour journey). All buses destined for Phuentsholing or
make a stop here.It is 17 Km by road from Jaigan and nearly 180Km to Thimpu from here.

value: is Asiatic one-horned rhinoceros. The sanctuary holds the highest rhino population in India after Kaziranga National Park in Assam. The other animals found are tigers, elephants, deers, sambhar, barking deer, spotted deer, hog deer, wild pig and bisons. Jaldapara is a paradise for bird watchers.

content= The forest forms an elephant corridor between Jaldapara and the Buxa Tiger Reserve and is rich in wildlife. There is a watch tower at Mandabari. One of the main attractions is the ruined "Nalraja Garh", or fort of the Nal kings, built in the Gupta period in the fifth century AD. Although poorly maintained, the site has considerable archaeological value.
alt= A new outfit near Chilapata Wildlife Sanctuary, run by Help Tourism.

Nearest tourist places are in Bhutan and Rajabhatkhowa and Jayanti. Both places are attractive for tourists.
